elements.text: Hi Delfina, I connected to this part especially- After I sent Toby that article, he thanked me and said he found the perspective very interesting, ‚Äúdistraction doesn‚Äôt really originate from the outside device or gadget, but rather from inside us.‚Äù

text: Something I‚Äôm thinking about after reading your article is the phrase ‚Äòto be present in the moment‚Äô- in a way, that is what I‚Äôd like to do more. But on the other hand, social media is so focused on the present moment/the instant/ What‚Äôs happening right now?/ Thursdays became a day to post something not from the present. I find myself deferring to social media instead of feeling for and formulating my own actions. For me to be more present in the moment, I want to start acting like a body more/ to feel embodied more. And when I do feel in my body more is when I feel least distracted.

And when I do feel in my body more is when I feel least distracted.

text: Also I appreciated the What to Do section- delaying any interaction with the phone every morning is something I‚Äôve been wanting to do, but stalling on.
